snippet: With a week left before votes are counted in India’s general election, the Indian National Congress is fighting to retain its hold in bastions like Amethi, where Rahul Gandhi visited this week.
abstract: Indian National Congress party is struggling to retain its grasp on traditional strongholds like Amethi, India, which had stood firmly behind the party and dynasty of Gandhi family for all but few years since India won independence; Rahul Gandhi, who is seeking a third term in the constituency, makes unusual move of visiting series of polling stations around Amethi in effort to drum up faltering support.
lead_paragraph: With a week left before votes are counted in India’s general election, the Indian National Congress is fighting to retain its hold in bastions like Amethi, where Rahul Gandhi visited this week.

headline.main: In Stronghold, a Gandhi Finds the Reception Is More Skeptical than Worshipful
headline.print_headline: In Stronghold, a Gandhi Finds the Reception Is More Skeptical than Worshipful
